pullRequest.body:
Adds an `IsAlgebraic` instance to the language of rings
Adds a `StrongHomClass` instance to the type of ring homomorphisms between rings with `CompatibleRing` structures

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [249f779a48](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16120/commits/249f779a4867f19a9cc85d875ef5eabb2ebe3e4f)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance : IsAlgebraic Language.ring := by`
`+ instance _root_.RingHomClass.toStrongHomClassRing {R : Type*} [NonAssocRing R] [CompatibleRing R]`
`+ ringEquivClass_of_HomClass`
`+ ringHomClass_of_homClass`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Looks okay to me based on my out of date knowledge of mathlib. I guess `languageEquivEquivRingEquiv` is obsolete now that we have `StrongHomClass`. Maybe it was already obsolete when it was added.

I completely missed that that `languageEquivEquivRingEquiv` was there, despite it being right above where I put this instance. I think it's kind of obsolete, but I should make sure it's easily replaced using this `StrongHomClass` instance.

I've made the proof of `languageEquivEquivRingEquiv` really simple with various homclass instances, but I'm never confident about determining whether I've created a bad instance loop, so somebody please check whether I should make some of these instances into `def`s or change priority.
Yeah - as I suspected, this loop is problematic, in that it's causing problems in `test/TCSynth.lean`. Which direction do we want to keep as an instance?

Do you want to implement [the two locales approach I alluded to](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2316120.20Ring.20homomorphisms.20as.20a.20StrongHomClass/near/464883938)?
I think that'd be good - worst case, one locale will end up getting used more, and we'll choose that one later.
This does seem to cause some slowdowns in TC synth. Maybe these could be defs, and locally you make them into instances?

```suggestion
instance _root_.RingHomClass.toStrongHomClassRing {R : Type*} [NonAssocRing R] [CompatibleRing R]
```
or something like that

pullRequest.title: feat(ModelTheory/Algebra/Ring/Basic): Ring homomorphisms are a `StrongHomClass` for the language of rings

### PR summary [249f779a48](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16120/commits/249f779a4867f19a9cc85d875ef5eabb2ebe3e4f)

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ instance : IsAlgebraic Language.ring := by`
`+ instance _root_.RingHomClass.toStrongHomClassRing {R : Type*} [NonAssocRing R] [CompatibleRing R]`
`+ ringEquivClass_of_HomClass`
`+ ringHomClass_of_homClass`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```

</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
Looks okay to me based on my out of date knowledge of mathlib. I guess `languageEquivEquivRingEquiv` is obsolete now that we have `StrongHomClass`. Maybe it was already obsolete when it was added.

I completely missed that that `languageEquivEquivRingEquiv` was there, despite it being right above where I put this instance. I think it's kind of obsolete, but I should make sure it's easily replaced using this `StrongHomClass` instance.

I've made the proof of `languageEquivEquivRingEquiv` really simple with various homclass instances, but I'm never confident about determining whether I've created a bad instance loop, so somebody please check whether I should make some of these instances into `def`s or change priority.
Yeah - as I suspected, this loop is problematic, in that it's causing problems in `test/TCSynth.lean`. Which direction do we want to keep as an instance?

Do you want to implement [the two locales approach I alluded to](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.2316120.20Ring.20homomorphisms.20as.20a.20StrongHomClass/near/464883938)?
I think that'd be good - worst case, one locale will end up getting used more, and we'll choose that one later.
This does seem to cause some slowdowns in TC synth. Maybe these could be defs, and locally you make them into instances?
